newsitem.title: VIETNAM: Twenty face trial in Vietnam fraud scandal.
newsitem.headline: Twenty face trial in Vietnam fraud scandal.

text.p: The state prosecution office in Vietnam's Ho Chi Minh City said on Friday 20 people would go on trial for alleged involvement in a fraud case that has sent shock waves through the political and financial establishment.
The prosecution office confirmed newspaper reports that listed the 20 who would be tried in the so-called Tamexco case, probably at the end of next month.
Among the accused were three former top brass of the communist country's largest state-owned bank, Vietcombank.
The affair stems from the alleged embezzlement of some $50 million via Tamexco, a Ho Chi Minh City-based import-export company affiliated to the party.
Local newspapers have given unprecedented coverage to the scandal, which has come at a time when the Communist Party is stepping up efforts to stamp out corruption.
